intro: Haplostylis albiceps, commonly known as the white-headed fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically white or pale green in color. The plant thrives in freshwater environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams, where it can anchor itself with its rhizomes. Its reproductive structures include small, yellowish flowers that develop into aquatic fruits. Haplostylis albiceps plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
